text: more than 24 hours after the earthquake
hit time is running out to find
survivors rescue workers medics are
working flat-out to save as many as they
can in a country used to earthquakes one
of this scale has come as a shock
flattened apartments collapse bridges
rubble everywhere flying straight to the
worst hit areas on Ecuador's coast
President Correa urged Ecuadorians to
stay strong
everything can be rebuilt he said but
lives cannot be recovered it's that that
hurts the most
it's the biggest tragedy I insist
in the last 67 years but my dear
homeland we will carry on we will learn
to surpass any obstacle more unity and
solidarity is needed today we are all
Ecuador the whole country is mobilized
to get to the victims of this tragedy
and to overcome as soon as possible
these painful moments more than 10,000
troops nearly 5000 police officers have
been deployed to help in the affected
areas but with landslides and twisted
roads it's not easy getting to some
areas people who resorted to social
media to ask authorities to do more to
get help to those who need it the
coastal town of Baudette an analyst a
beach resort popular with tourists was
one of the hardest hit residents
surveying what's left of their homes the
grief is everyone since the quake on
Saturday there have been more than 200
aftershocks many families are choosing
to stay outside scared to go home in
case there's more to come Katie Watson
BBC news in Quito
